author: Collins
comments: 2011, PhD thesis, University of Cambridge, Institute of Astronomy

author: Legentil
comments: 1755, Sav. etrangers, Vol. II (Paris: Academie Royale des Sciences), 137

author: Schuster & West
comments: Originally thought to be a globular cluster. Canterna & Flower (1977ApJ...212L..57C) subsequently identified its galactic nature.

author: Lavery
comments: This author first suggested that this object is a member of the Local Group, but it had previously been cataloged by Corwin et al. (1985sgcc.book.....C).

author: Kopylov et al.
comments: These authors calculate a new distance to UGC 4879and show that it is on the periphery of the Local Group. While included in Vorontsov-Velyaminov (1959VV....C......0V), earlier references to this object have not been found.

author: Whiting et al.
comments: These authors rediscovered this galaxy and showed that it was in the periphery of the Local Group, but it had earlier been cataloged by Corwin et al. (1985sgcc.book.....C), Feitzinger & Galinski (1985A&AS...61..503F), and Arp & Madore (1987cspg.book.....A).

author: Henning et al.
comments: HIZSS 3 resolved into two sources by Begum et al. (2005MNRAS.359L..53B). Position corresponds to the 'HIZSS3 system'.

author: Karachentseva & Karachentsev
comments: Cat. J/A+AS/127/409. See also Karachentseva et al. (1999A&AS..135..221K)

author: Reaves
comments: Discovered on inspection of photographic plates from a survey discussed in Shane (1947PASP...59..182S). C. D. Shane speculated that some of the nebulae that were visible could be Local Group dwarf galaxies.
